channel.title: BBC News | Technology | World Edition
channel.description: Visit BBC News for up-to-the-minute news, breaking news, video, audio and feature stories. BBC News provides trusted World and UK news as well as local and regional perspectives. Also entertainment, business, science, technology and health news.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Wireless boost for British cities
item.description: A dozen UK cities are getting wireless internet zones as part of a project by telecoms giant BT.

item.title: Ofcom rethinks ban on iPod gadget
item.description: Ofcom is working on an EU-wide standard for a banned device which transmits songs from iPods.

item.title: War vets feature in US army game
item.description: The US Army is putting soldiers who fought in Iraq into its game in a bid to put a human face on its operations.

item.title: 'Big brother' informs baby talk
item.description: A newborn baby is being filmed for the next three years to understand how he learns to talk.

item.title: Broadband boost helps BT results
item.description: BT reports a 6% rise in annual revenues, with a strong rise in broadband incomes offsetting a drop in its fixed-line unit.

item.title: Web attacks end anti-spam effort
item.description: Net attacks by spammers have forced an Israeli firm to abandon its campaign to curb the growth of junk mail.

item.title: Satellite radio in recordings row
item.description: US satellite broadcaster XM is being sued over a gadget that lets people record what they are listening to.

item.title: Gamers to help create web record
item.description: Games fans are being asked to contribute to an online encyclopaedia to complete a history of videogames.

item.title: Apple moves all laptops to Intel
item.description: Apple has moved closer to completing its shift to Intel chips with the launch of new consumer Macbook models.

item.title: Central Park to be wireless hub
item.description: New York announces plans to offer free wireless internet connections in Central Park from this summer.

item.title: MTV targets music downloads
item.description: MTV, the TV firm credited with popularising music videos, is entering the digital download market.

item.title: Apple rival 'tries to ban iPods'
item.description: Digital music player business Creative is trying to ban the sale and advertising of iPods in the US in a patent row.

item.title: Yahoo homepage gets make-over
item.description: Search giant Yahoo is revamping its home page to introduce customisation tools for visitors.

item.title: Gadget firms tackled on usability
item.description: Technology companies are being encouraged to think more about how to make gadgets easy to use.

item.title: £5m bid to power future gadgets
item.description: Five universities unite in an attempt to design a new generation of tiny electronic circuits for computers and other devices.

item.title: Telewest offers HDTV World Cup
item.description: Telewest customers can watch the World Cup in high-definition, after the firm agrees deals with ITV and the BBC.

item.title: PlayStation 3 rethinks card games
item.description: Sony is re-imagining the way we play card games with one title for the forthcoming PlayStation 3.

item.title: Halo 3 tops Xbox Live downloads
item.description: Catch up with the latest news from the world of video gaming.

item.title: Top spin tennis courts success
item.description: Top Spin 2 for the Xbox 360 does a competent job of bringing the game to life in your hands.
